inputs.name: showHelp
inputs.reason: Set the `helpKey` or `helpPopoverContent` inputs instead.

inputs.name: tabHeaderCount
inputs.reason: SKY UX no longer recommends adding counts to tabs.

inputs.name: ariaControls
inputs.reason: Now that the vertical tabs provide aria labels automatically, this input is no longer necessary.

inputs.name: ariaRole
inputs.reason: Any other value than `tab` could lead to a poor user experience for users with assistive technology. In the next major version, this property will be automatically set to `tab`.

inputs.name: tabId
inputs.reason: Now that the vertical tabs provide aria labels automatically, this input is no longer necessary.

inputs.name: ariaRole
inputs.reason: Any other value than `tablist` could lead to a poor user experience for users with assistive technology. In the next major version, this property will be automatically set to `tablist`.

inputs.name: bindHeightToWindow
inputs.reason: We recommend using the `dock` input instead. An example of this can be found in the developer code examples.

inputs.name: displayMode
inputs.reason:
The property was designed to create wizards by setting `displayMode="horizontal"` on progress indicators in modals, but this wizard implementation was replaced by the
[Wizard (Tabs) component](https://developer.blackbaud.com/skyux/components/progress-indicator).

inputs.name: trigger
inputs.reason: We recommend against using this property. If you choose to use the deprecated `hover` value anyway, we recommend that you not use it in combination with the `title` property.

inputs.name: skyPopoverTrigger
inputs.reason: To ensure usability on touch devices, trigger user-invoked popovers on `click` actions rather than `mouseenter` actions.

inputs.name: autocompleteAttribute
inputs.reason: SKY UX only supports browser autofill on components where the direct input matches the return value. This input may not behave as expected due to the dropdown selection interaction.

inputs.name: propertiesToSearch
inputs.reason: We recommend against using this property. To search specific properties, use the `searchAsync` event instead.
